recordingInstruction.title: Things to know
recordingInstruction.instructionTitle: Please ensure the following conditions before taking a photo:
recordingInstruction.secondInstruction: Take a photo in a well-lit area
recordingInstruction.thirdInstruction: Do not wear glasses or masks
recordingInstruction.fourthInstruction: Take a close-up photo of the acne-affected area

privacyPolicy.text3: ZenS has developed the DigitFace app as a free application. This service is provided by ZenS at no cost and is used as is.
privacyPolicy.text4: This page is used to inform users about our policies regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of Personal Information for those who choose to use our Service.
privacyPolicy.text5: If you choose to use our Service, you agree to the collection and use of information in relation to this policy. The Personal Information we collect is used to provide and improve the Service. We will not use or share your information with anyone except as described in this Privacy Policy.
privacyPolicy.text6: The terms used in this Privacy Policy have the same meanings as in our Terms and Conditions, which can be accessed at DigitFace, unless otherwise defined in this Privacy Policy.
privacyPolicy.text8: To provide a better experience while using our Service, we may ask you to provide certain personally identifiable information. The information we request will be retained on your device and is not collected by us in any way except as specified in this policy.
privacyPolicy.text9: The application may use third-party services that collect information used to identify you.
privacyPolicy.text8b: We do not collect or store face data; everything is processed locally on your device. Media generated by the application is stored in the app’s archive file and will be deleted when you uninstall the app.
privacyPolicy.text9b: Please note that all data is processed entirely on your device and is not stored or shared with any third parties. We are committed to protecting your privacy and do not collect, store, or use this information for any purposes other than providing interactive features within the app.
privacyPolicy.text10: Account Deletion and Email Reuse Policy
privacyPolicy.text11: When you choose to delete your account on the DigitFace app, all personal data related to the account, including your email address, will be deleted or anonymized according to our data retention policy.
privacyPolicy.text13: • Email Reuse: After deleting your account, the email address you used to originally register may not be immediately available for reuse. This is due to security measures and internal processes that may temporarily retain your email for compliance, fraud prevention, or to maintain system integrity.
privacyPolicy.text14: • Email Reuse: After deleting your account, the email address you used to originally register may not be immediately available for reuse. This is due to security measures and internal processes that may temporarily retain your email for compliance, fraud prevention, or to maintain system integrity.
privacyPolicy.text15: • Permanent Restrictions: In rare cases, an email address may be permanently restricted from re-registering if it has been flagged for policy violations, abuse, or other serious reasons.
privacyPolicy.text16: If you have any questions or issues related to reusing your email for a new account, please contact our support team for assistance.
privacyPolicy.text18: Whenever you use our Service, in the case of an error in the application, we collect data and information (through third-party products) on your phone called Log Data. This Log Data may include information such as your device’s Internet Protocol (IP) address, device name, operating system version, application configuration when using our Service, the time and date of your use of the Service, and other statistics.
privacyPolicy.text20: Cookies are files with a small amount of data, which may include an anonymous unique identifier. Cookies are sent to your browser from the websites you visit and are stored on your device's internal memory.
privacyPolicy.text21: This Service does not explicitly use these “cookies”. However, the app may use code and third-party libraries that use “cookies” to collect information and improve their services. You have the option to accept or refuse these cookies and know when a cookie is sent to your device. If you choose to refuse our cookies, you may not be able to use some parts of this Service.
privacyPolicy.text23: We may employ third-party companies and individuals for the following reasons:
privacyPolicy.text25: • To provide the Service on our behalf;
privacyPolicy.text27: • To assist us in analyzing how our Service is used.
privacyPolicy.text28: We want to inform users of this Service that these third parties have access to your Personal Information. The reason is to perform the tasks assigned to them on our behalf. However, they are obligated not to disclose or use the information for any other purpose.
privacyPolicy.text30: We value your trust in providing us your Personal Information, thus we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect it. However, please remember that no method of transmission over the Internet or method of electronic storage is 100% secure and reliable, and we cannot guarantee its absolute security.
privacyPolicy.text32: This Service may contain links to other sites. If you click on a third-party link, you will be directed to that site. Note that these external sites are not operated by us. Therefore, we strongly advise you to review the Privacy Policy of these websites. We have no control over and assume no responsibility for the content, privacy policies, or practices of any third-party sites or services.
privacyPolicy.text34: This Service does not address anyone under the age of 13. We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from children under 13. If we become aware that we have collected personal information from children under 13 without verification of parental consent, we take steps to remove that information from our servers. If you are a parent or guardian and you are aware that your child has provided us with personal information, please contact us so that we can take the necessary actions.
privacyPolicy.text36: We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. Thus, you are advised to review this page periodically for any changes. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page.
privacyPolicy.text38: If you have any questions or suggestions about our Privacy Policy, do not hesitate to contact us at contact@zen-s.com

acne.emptyAcne: Acne was not detected in your photo
acne.descBlackhead: Blackheads form when oil and dead skin cells accumulate in pores and are exposed to air, causing them to oxidize and turn black.
acne.descWhitehead: Whiteheads appear when pores become clogged with excess oil, dead skin cells, and bacteria, but are not exposed to air.
acne.descPapular: Papules are small, red, non-pus-filled inflammatory pimples.
acne.descPurulent: Pustules contain white or yellow fluid, appear due to inflammation, and are painful to the touch.
acne.descCystic: Cystic acne is a very severe form of inflammatory acne, containing a lot of pus, often large in size, with a high risk of leaving permanent scars.
acne.descKeloid: Keloid scars are overgrowths of scar tissue after skin injury, which are red or dark in color and feel hard or uncomfortable.
acne.descFlatWart: Flat warts are caused by the HPV virus, have a smooth surface, and often grow in clusters, mainly on the face or hands.
acne.descMilium: Milia are small, non-inflammatory cysts containing keratin, often appearing around the eyes or on the face.
acne.descFolliculitis: Folliculitis, caused by bacteria or fungus, usually occurs in the hairy area and can be itchy or painful.
acne.descSeboCrystanConglo: A mixed type of acne that combines whiteheads, blackheads, pustules, and cysts. It commonly occurs in oily areas and tends to form clusters, causing severe skin damage.
acne.descSyringoma: Syringomas are small, benign, painless growths that often appear around the eyes or forehead.
acne.descAcneScars: Acne scars are long-term damage caused by improper acne treatment or severe inflammatory acne. Scars include icepick scars, boxcar scars, and hypertrophic scars, affecting skin texture and aesthetics.
acne.consolutionBlackhead: The presence of blackheads suggests clogged pores without inflammation.
acne.consolutionWhitehead: Whiteheads indicate clogged pores but no signs of inflammation.
acne.consolutionPapular: Small red pimples indicate mild inflammation of the skin pores.
acne.consolutionPurulent: Many pustules indicate severe inflammation of the skin and need timely treatment.
acne.consolutionCystic: Numerous cystic acne indicates severe inflammation and hormonal imbalance.
acne.consolutionKeloid: Keloid formation indicates an overreaction of the skin during the healing process.
acne.consolutionFlatWart: Flat warts suggest the skin has been exposed to the HPV virus and may be easily transmissible.
acne.consolutionMilium: The presence of small milia suggests keratin buildup beneath the skin surface.
acne.consolutionFolliculitis: Frequent folliculitis indicates irritation or bacterial infection in the hair follicles.
acne.consolutionSeboCrystanConglo: A complex type of acne requiring medical intervention and proper skincare to prevent further damage and long-term scarring.
acne.consolutionSyringoma: Syringomas indicate abnormal sweat gland activity but do not cause inflammation.
acne.consolutionAcneScars: Requires advanced treatment at dermatology clinics for long-term results, combined with proper skincare to prevent further damage.
acne.suggestAcneScars1: Use scar treatment creams with onion extract or allantoin to improve skin texture
acne.suggestAcneScars2: Apply sunscreen daily to prevent scars from darkening
acne.suggestAcneScars3: Treat with fractional CO2 laser, microneedling, or dermarolling at reputable clinics to regenerate skin.
acne.suggestAcneScars4: Apply PRP (platelet-rich plasma) therapy to enhance skin renewal
acne.suggestAcneScars5: Use fillers for deep scars to temporarily improve skin appearance
acne.suggestBlackhead2: Use a clay or charcoal mask for deep cleansing
acne.suggestBlackhead3: Keep your face clean, avoid heavy makeup
acne.suggestCystic1: Treatment with isotretinoin, cortisone injections, or minor surgery
acne.suggestCystic2: See a dermatologist for close monitoring
acne.suggestCystic3: Use intensive medical therapy to reduce damage
acne.suggestFlatWart1: Apply a medication containing salicylic acid
acne.suggestFlatWart3: See a doctor if the wart spreads
acne.suggestFolliculitis1: Keep the affected skin area clean
acne.suggestFolliculitis2: Use antibiotic or antifungal topical medications
acne.suggestFolliculitis3: Avoid wearing tight clothing to limit friction that causes irritation
acne.suggestKeloid1: Treatment with corticosteroid injections or laser.
acne.suggestMilium1: Exfoliate gently or use a product containing retinol.
acne.suggestMilium2: Get your milia removed at a reputable facility
acne.suggestMilium3: Use a moisturizer that won't clog pores
acne.suggestPapular1: Use anti-inflammatory products such as creams containing benzoyl peroxide or sulfur
acne.suggestPapular2: Avoid squeezing pimples to reduce the risk of further inflammation
acne.suggestPapular3: Eat foods rich in vitamin A and zinc
acne.suggestPurulent1: Use antibacterial creams or acne creams containing benzoyl peroxide
acne.suggestPurulent3: See a dermatologist if your pimples do not improve or spread
acne.suggestSeboCrystanConglo1: Treatment with isotretinoin or high-dose antibiotics
acne.suggestSeboCrystanConglo2: Medical therapy such as laser or cortisone injections
acne.suggestSeboCrystanConglo3: Close monitoring by a dermatologist to limit complications
acne.suggestSyringoma1: If removal is necessary, apply laser or minor surgery
acne.suggestSyringoma2: Consult your doctor for appropriate measure
acne.suggestWhitehead1: Wash your face twice a day with a gentle cleanser
acne.suggestWhitehead2: Use a product containing salicylic acid or benzoyl peroxide
acne.suggestWhitehead3: Avoid popping pimples to prevent infection
